ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My speaking and comfort increased greatly. Also, my knowledge and understanding of both current and ancient Chinese culture increased. Truly fabulous course!
I continued to develop my Chinese, and made important strides!
I learned how to write essays better and learn the flow of chinese patterns and writing in a more nuanced way. I learned a lot about chinese culture and history in a way that I've never learned about
Learnt a lot of advanced vocab, interesting stuff about chinese culture and modern social and political issues
I have a firmer grasp of the Chinese language certainly, but more than that this class was fantastic at delving into the culture of China and Taiwan.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Fabulous teacher! One of the best instructors I have had at Yale. Lots of daily work but worth it.
Strengths: Everything about Zhou Laoshi: passionate, clear, understanding, careful Weakness: Assignment schedule: Unclear, confusing, not enough notification.
The greatest weakness of this course is the textbook - it really is rather boring. Maybe using other media sources or switching textbooks might help.

Zhou laoshi is engaging, wonderful and understanding. He makes the class fun and interesting. the weekly quizzes are great to learn new vocabulary and keep up with the text. I liked the oral presentation because it made you really think about words you learned in class and how to express them fluently. the essays were important in solidifying new sentence patterns and vocab.
You learn a lot of vocab and interesting stuff about china The very structured syllabus gets a bit tedious
This was an excellent course that allows you to get out as much as you put in. At times I wish that we had more discussion time.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely would recommend! Great way to improve your Chinese
This is a great way to finish the basic Chinese curriculum; engaging topics, great teacher.
This is an incredibly chill course, and one you must take if you wish to take electives.
Yes, it's good and you probably need it to keep going with chinese

Zhou Laoshi is fantastic and is highly motivated to help the individual student succeed. He understands well the level of the students and the class and helps everyone to improve based on where they are. I would certainly recommend this course! He is always available to help.
